taskDescription: Allenes are compounds with adjacent carbon–carbon double bonds. Many allenes are chiral, even though they don’t contain chirality centers. Mycomycin, for example, a naturally occurring antibiotic isolated from the bacterium Nocardia acidophilus, is chiral and has [α]D = −130. Explain why mycomycin is chiral.
